content: Yes, a well-planned plant-based diet can provide enough calcium for healthy bones. Plant-based sources of calcium include leafy greens such as kale and collard greens, beans and legumes, fortified plant milks such as soy and almond milk, calcium-set tofu, and nuts and seeds like almonds and chia seeds. It’s important to also ensure adequate vitamin D intake, as it helps the body absorb calcium. Vitamin D can be found in fortified plant milks, mushrooms (when exposed to sunlight), and supplements.
